Ulasan: A cool waterfall near the beach, not too crowded. People aren't allowed to bath in the waterfall. The rocks are quite slippery. Free entry, only pay for parking. There's still lots of small animals on the beach like hermit crab and little …
Several years ago when i first visited this place, it was nice, everything is made by nature, but today i saw huge improvements that makes it even better. There is even a cafe! Well done, Sampang!

good view waterfall and area was in the main road so access so easy.
free entrance ticket but for car parking have to pay 10.000 rupiah per car.
access to waterfall from parking area not too far just walking go down by around …
Came here several times over the past 5 years. Looks much more developed and clean. Food is good and ample safe parking. Service at restaurant was not friendly on my recent visit.

Best mini waterfall ! Although need 3 to 4 hours to get there from surabaya. But its worth it, got a nice sunset view and fresh water from the waterfall, the waterfall itself falldown through to sea and have an clear view of water. Nice one !

Such a peaceful and beautiful place! The best time to go here is sunset(which unfirtunately, I can not see the sunset there because I went there in the rainy season). But taking picture here in blue hour is also great. I spent a night here …
Best place to visit, I love this location

Toroan waterfalls is a tourist destination in Sampang. It's located near of Ketapang traditional market. This waterfalls close to the beach so that the water will flow to the sea. This place is not recommended for children because there is not sufficient area for playing and prohibited to swim here.

Unique waterfall. The water fall directly in to the sea/beach. This is the biggest waterfall in Madura. We must be very carefull when walking around the beach near the waterfall. Dont ever swim under the waterfall.

Although a distance from Surabaya to here is god damn so far, around 100 kilometers, but believe me that worth it at all! The waterfall drop directly into the sea, very unique. But remember, you can't swim in there because there is a hole below the waterfall.

It is an adorable place, which is a great spot for relax and take a picture. The access is easy. But the road from Bangkalan to this area is not in a good condition. We must drive carefully. But still, must go place once before you die !
Man made waterfalls, it’s a diverted overflow from a nearby river to the sea. Ingenious though. Need to walk down 50 steps stair. There’s a small area where people can enjoy the “waterfall”

small waterfall, but has an easy access, near the public road. the panorama at sunset is very beautiful. you can go down below the waterfall to take some pictures, but be careful because there are many rocks around there. still it's one of several popular waterfall in Madura Island. it's recommended place to visit when you're in Madura.

Terletak di pinggir jalan.
Saat musim hujan, tangga becek dan licin.

Nice and interesting waterfall directly go to the sea. The problem is alot of trash on sea and the rocks around the waterfall/beach. Cheap ebtry only 5 thousand. If you go here, please no trashing. I hope people who work there can clean the place not only asking for entry fee.
Small but beautiful. People were very nice!

super dissapointing, everything isn't treated well. Many trashes are everywhere in the floors , water is pretty much brown and dirty. i dont understand why the rating is 4 tho ??. it is so different with the pics on the google, where the …

It's unique ... the water drop into the sea directly
But it is a river used by local, so the pungent smell is noticable …
a good place to rest when you are on a long trip

Easy access, quite clean area, clear water, waterfall right next to the seaside. Good place for photographs and to just chill by the beach with running waterfall behind. Free, only fee for parking. Available toilet, bathroom, and Mushola with praying equipment inside (Qur'an, mukena, sarung, etc.)

It's a waterfall falling  into the sea. Not much else to see and not particularly picturesque, but interesting enough to visit. The little warung at the top is ok, with decent food. There are toilets available.
It is adorable.. But the place is so far about 45 minutes from Sampang city, and also a bit hard to get here.. Must use your own vehicle, not really sure there is a public transport to get here..
Beautiful waterfall right at the beach with sunset.

The unique thing is this waterfall is directly poured into the sea (beach).
The height is about 9 meter.
Easy access with lot of visitors during holiday..
hidden mini waterfall and beach. You can see two place in one time.
